Name: Life on the Farm: Preschool Edition
Description:
From the publisher:

Preschoolers love the happy animal scenes, deep colors and soft feel of We R FUN’s new preschool edition of “Life on the Farm”. Designed for the Ages 3 - 7 demographic, the soft non-toxic foam playmat (for floor play) is a huge 5-piece puzzle. When assembled, the playmate becomes the gameboard. Match colors to move - land on an animal square and get a matching animal puzzle piece to put into a soft barn puzzle. Fill the barn with animals to win. This game quickly became a favorite when tested by early education specialists.

Name: Cousin-cousine
Description:
A magazine game from Jeux et StratÃ©gie #60.

Stratego-like game in the context of a rivalry between two little villages. The loser must organize the pétanque competition !

Name: The Worst-Case Scenario Card Game: Cooking
Description:
The Worst-Case Scenario card Game - Cooking

Back of the Box:
Boost your kitchen savvy. Learn to survive culinary catastrophes - from opening a bottle of wine without a corkscrew to fixing an over-salted soup. Whether it's dinner for 10 or a meal on the go - you'll be prepared to handle any cooking crisis.

Contents
55 Cards with 108 Questions

Object of the Game
Be the first to consecutively survive 5 scenarios

Players take turns to ask each other the questions on the cards: a correct answer means that they continue asking, wrong means that they pass the questions to the player who was answering who then proceeds.

Name: Molly's  Mystery Party Game A Spy on the Home Front
Description:
From the box:  Solve a mystery with Molly.  It's Halloween night - but something mysterious has happened to the candy Molly and her friends collected!  Everyone seems to have a motive, so everyone's a suspect.  It's up to you and your friends to find the clues, crack the secret code, and unscramble the mystery!

How the Game Works:  The mystery features characters from the popular Molly stories. The invitations you send out will tell your friends which character they'll play.  On the party day, you and your guests can dress up and "get in character".  Together, you'll read the script, search for clues - and solve the mystery!

Home Page: http://www.pleasantcopublications.com/characters/molly/SpyOnTheHomeFront.aspx

Name: Silly Sandwich
Description:
For children Ages 4 - 8.

A great game for little folks! Loads of fun trying to make the biggest, daffiest, silliest sandwich of all! [from box]

Roll the dice and move around the board. When you land on a picture of the refrigerator, choose a food item to add to your sandwich. If a player lands on a puppy or kitty square, an ingredient is lost.

Name: Stupiduel Fantasy Expansion
Description:
From the back of the box:

"Once upon a time there was a little expansion deck. This deck was full of marvelous creatures and magical artifacts which, in responsible hands, could have been used to create wondrous tales of fantastic adventure.

However, these cards wound up in your hands instead, and you're a raving mad stupiduelist!

This 60 card expansion to Stupiduel can be used to turn your original deck into a pure fantasy deck, or just shuffled right in. Either way, your Stupiduel matches will be transformed by its powerful contents, allowing attacks that could only be dreamed of, defenses that could only be wished for, and conclusions that will leave you laughing happily ever after!"

Expands

    Stupiduel

Name: Go Teddy Go!
Description:
From the Ravensburger Catalog:

The bears love to play hide and seek! Roll the colored die, move along the path, and hide your three bears first to win. A sliding panel reveals caves for the bears to disappear into as their laughter sounds from a hidden voice chip!

Involves color recognition, association, simple strategy.

Ages 4 and up.

Name: Panda Go Round
Description:
From the Educational Insights catalog:

Panda-Go-Round is a fast paced race game of "turn and find," where each turn of the tube reveals a new expression on the panda's face, from happy or sad to sleepy - even surprised! Be the first to exactly match the expression on the panda's face with the one on the card and claim the card. Corresponding symbols on the tubes and inside the cards make the game self-checking. The player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner. Builds visual discrimination skills, a key to reading success. Includes 2 face-maker tubes and 16 cards.

Ages 4 and up.

Name: Step To It
Description:
From the back of the box:

Here's a game that will have you walking, jumping, and hopping all around the house! Ask a player to give you a card with a specific number of steps to take. Then choose an object that you think you can reach in exactly that number. Can you walk to the fridge in 9 steps? How about hop to something that starts with the letter A in 15? Reach your goal and walk away with a win!

Ages 5 and up.

Kids learn estimating distance and spacial relations.

Name: Hostage: The Board Game
Description:
THE CRISIS:
A world famous physicist, noted for discovering a new fuel source, has been kidnapped and is being held hostage in a remote jungle fortress somewhere near the equator. Intelligence sources believe the physicist will reveal the new fuel source to whomever liberates him.

THE MISSION:
As Chief of Intelligence for a world superpower, you control the movements of a special secret agent/army commando rescue team in a daring plot to liberate the physicist and return him to your home embassy. You must outwit and outmaneuver each of your opponents if your mission is to succeed. Careful planning is crucial to avoid setbacks along the way. A word of advice: keep your team together and above all, watch your back!

Name: War in the Pampas
Description:
February of 1994. The Argentine military retakes power through a coup de etat. The Argentine civil government manages to find exile in neighboring Uruguay. The Argentine military issues an ultimatum to Uruguay to hand over the fugitives or face an invasion. Brazil guarantees the defense of Uruguay in the event of a Argentine invasion. Argentina launches a surprise invasion of Uruguay precipitating a counter attack from the Brazilians thus starting the war of the Pampas.

The war of the Pampas is a Brazilian designed Alternate history wargame of a war between Argentina vs. Uruguay and Brazil in an alternate early 90s.

The game consists of 169 counters representing the military forces of Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay. 12 pages of rules. and special rules such as artillery, air support and more...

Name: Combo
Description: Game comes with a rule sheet and 60 cards. This is an inexpensive and pocketable little word building game that actually has strategy considerations. When to play a single letter card, when to play a "combo" card, when to sweep the table? Wow! This is Combo. For 2 to 5 teens & adults

Name: Temple of the Monkey
Description:
From Playroom Catalog:

Be the first to reach the Temple of the Monkey in this Action packed card game of jungle adventure!  Each player takes on the role of a daring explorer racing along a unique path to the temple, battling raging rapids, dangerous predators, and most importantly, each other!  Every step along the path comes with its own challenges, and explorers must be prepared for whatever comes their way.

Players must travel down their own set of path cards, representing the obstacles standing between them and the Temple.  Use your equipment cards to overcome the hurdles in your path, and your tactics to foul up your opponents efforts, but most of all, use your wits as you race to the Temple of the Monkey!

Name: Road Safety
Description:
Players roll the dice and completes a driving test in order to move their token through the driving circuit.

Contains a road safety message from Jack Brabham.

Produced by "Ampol - The Australian Company".

Name: Principles of War: 19th Century – Army Lists for Africa, India, Asia, the Far East, the Americas and post World War One
Description:
[From the inside cover]
These lists are designed to cover warfare around the world from the Napoleonic Wars until the opening of the First World War, with some lists to cover the chaotic period after the war including the Russian Revolution.

Within each list, the armies have been sorted by conflict with participants where possible listed together. You will note that each army list has a points value listed against it, all armies do not have the same points values, this is because some conflicts were smaller than others and we did not wish to artificially inflate army sizes just to get a standard points value.
Families: Series: Principles of War – Miniature Wargame Rules (Tom Penn)

Name: 96 Kabal
Description:
This cardgame is a multi-player solitaire. The deck consists of 96 cards (hence the name), 6 of each in the numbers 1 through 16. You can be as many players as you like, but each players will need his own deck.

One player shuffles his deck and draws the cards, one by one, telling the others what he drew, so all players will get their cards out in the same order (similar mechanic to Take it Easy).

The point is to build stacks of cards going from 1 to 16. When the last card is drawn points are awarded for how many complete stacks you've managed to build.

Name: Dick Tracy The Master Detective Game
Description:
A simple children's race game which takes place on a bright yellow street map of the town.  The board and its spaces are illustrated with characters from the Dick Tracy comic strip.  Based on the famous character from cartoons and television shows.

Components include a gameboard; 5 pawns (4 Deputies, 1 Villain); 28 loot cards (4 ea. Blank; Drug; Apparel; Fur; Jewelry; Bond; Cash); Spinner.

Name: Space Race
Description:
The object of the game is to build a rocket made up of four sections, and then navigate it through space following a set flight plan that is drawn at the start of the game.

As you explore each new star system, a section of your rocket is jettisoned and the rocket accelerates until it reaches maximum speed and heads for your home system. The first player to complete their flight plan wins the game.

Game Contents:

• 1 Large playing board divided into two main sections depicting a rocket gantry for the preparation of the rocket and a star map for traveling through space.

• 6 Counters in six different colors

• 6 Rockets in six different colors, each rocket is made up of four sections.

• 6 Flight Plans

• 24 Flight Check Cards

• 1 Die

• 1 Dice cup

• 1 Rules booklet

Name: Bendomino Jr.
Description: A version of Bendomino for Ages 3 and up, where you match pictures instead of dots. Game comes with 28 wooden Bendominoes and a cotton pouch.
Families: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

Name: Marine World
Description:
The object of the game is to be the player to have the most points when the game ends. (Copied from the game's instructions)
Players roll a die and move their token first to complete the 'car' track, then to use their boats to move to different islands.  Different spaces will allow players to draw a card from the elephant deck.  Alternatively players may visit shops to collect souvenir cards.  When a player reaches the end of the track the game ends.

Name: Cricket Card Game
Description:
K Cricket consists of 50 cards: 17 Bowling cards and 33 Batting cards, each showing a particular type of delivery e.g. Good Length, Bouncer, Cut, Hook. Play consists of the bowling player playing a card and the batting player trying to match it with a scoring or defensive stroke. If the batting player has only a dismissal to match the ball bowled, he must play it and his batsman is out.

The game is played in six-ball overs, the bowling player drawing a new hand after each over while the batting player continues with the hand they were initially dealt but draws to refill his hand after each ball bowled.

Players can play an agreed number of overs or a full 10-wicket innings each.

Name: Binary
Description:
Binary is a series of 4 games that use a unique deck of cards.  One side of the deck is all black the other side is all white.
The games require a basic knowledge of binary numbers, which the rules provide.

Binary I - a basic game of each player dealing out 4 cards and the highest number takes the pot. (an introduction into binary numbers)

Binary II - similar to Binary I, but players lay the 4 cards one at a time.

Binary III - similar to Binary II, but players lay the 4 cards one at a time, allowing players to raise if they believe they will have the highest number

Binary IV - players across from the table play with the same 4 cards to change it into the highest number.  Each plays from their own perspective.

Name: Dear Judge Ichiro
Description:
Dear Judge Ichiro: the Board Game’ is a group game for 3 or more players derived from the novel Dear Judge Ichiro by Trevor Ryan (Zeus Publications).  
It is based on problem solving, specifically anagrams, listening comprehension, parables, and proverbs.

Home Page: http://www.geocities.com/kevinbonbevan/index.htm

Name: Cinematique
Description:
This is a party game, along the lines of Cranium, but all about the movies.
The production values are very high, and there are more than 1300 cards, each with four questions/activities on them, making it pretty re-playable.
The cards are split onto 4 eras - The Studio Years (1927 to '49), The Independent Years (1950 to '69), The Corporate Years (1970 to '89) and The Blockbuster Years (1990 to 2006), and each team only has to complete two eras, so the game can be played with different age groups.
There are 6 different activities on the cards:
Cutting Room (A pot-potpourri of quotes, quips and quirky facts from both on- and off-screen)
Rushes (The players are the stars as they re-create famous scenes from favorite films)
Soundtrack (Hum, whistle, pound the piano or use the Cinematique kazoos to perform film songs)
Casting (Questions about famous roles, fabulous pairings and the actors who created them)
Screen Test (Mime classic scenes, impersonate the stars or be a legend of the silver screen)
Credits (An optional activity and something for the film buffs - hard, but rewarding)

Name: Blackpowder
Description: Minis-rules for 1600-1870. Skirmish level, up to about 40 men per player. Free download.

Name: Inference
Description:
Publisher:
"The object of the game is to be the first player to go from elementary school through college while answering inference questions."

Name: Oz Quiz
Description:
Australian Trivia Game

Over 2000 Questions in the following catagories:

People
Places
Slang
Sport
Animals & Plants
History

And the wacky activity "Up The Creek" category.

Packaged in an Australian esky!

Name: Racing
Description:
Racing is, of course, a racing game. Place the cars on the start line, roll the die and be first to the finish line. If you land on a square with star, you draw an event card which lets you advance some spaces, miss a turn, move again or similar.  
Other squares have text that tells what happens when you land on them, for instance:  "You drive perfectly through the first curve. You get an extra die roll" and 
"Trouble with the engine. Move 10 squares backwards".

First car to the finish line wins the game

Name: Bummer
Description:
In Bummer, players use 5 dice to try to score points.  They set aside scoring dice and may continue with the rest.

Bummer predates Farkle and has different scoring methods.  Players score on 1s and 5s and also three of a kind, four of a kind and straights in a single roll.

Name: McNaughty Trivia
Description: This is an adult-themed game to taste the sexual knowledge of the participants.  It is a fast, fun game with mainly esoteric questions; for example: "How many dating agencies were there in Britain at the start of 1994?" and "Who invented the contraceptive pill?".   Players attempt to answer questions correctly from 3 possible answers to move around a scoreboard ahead of their opponents.

Name: De Bellis Fantasticus: Here There Be Dragons
Description:
This is a supplement for the De Bellis Multitudinis: Wargames Rules for Ancient and Medieval Battles â€“ 3000 BC to 1500 AD miniature wargame rules. It adds rules and army lists to add fantasy elements similar to how Hordes of the Things (HOTT) added these to De Bellis Antiquitatis (DBA). The three categories of army lists are Popular (Warhammer), Mythology, and Traditional (Tolkien).

Expands

    De Bellis Multitudinis: Wargames Rules for Ancient and Medieval Battles â€“ 3000 BC to 1500 AD

Name: Junior Table Top Bowling Alley Game
Description:
This game features 10 scaled bowling pins, 3 bowling balls, and a real return track, an adjustable spring bowler, scoring pads.

The game also includes an application for a junior bowling league.

From the box cover; "A game of fun and skill for the whole family."

Name: Giant Wheel Cowboys & Indians
Description: Game features a giant wheel that looks somewhat like a large gambling wheel, and a giant gameboard. Simple game of spin the wheel and move along the gameboard, first to finish wins the game. Ages 6 - 12

Name: Fran Tarkenton's Pro Football
Description:
Fran Tarkenton's Pro Football was a playable yet highly detailed simulation of pro football in the days before the NFL and AFL consolidated. (Tarkenton was a New York Giant quarterback at the time – before he led the Vikings to three Super Bowls.)

The game was advanced for the time, and very much a simulation. The game used 23 offensive basic plays and 8 defensive lines. Unlike some contemporaries and many lesser football games, the proper defense will limit the damage of a great roll. Despite the limited number of offensive plays, there are plenty of choices since the plays can showcase feature positions. Also, beyond the 8 defensive setups, the defensive player can also have the choice of which player to 'key' on. Of course, double-covering the wrong receiver will allow a lesser roll to have a higher result.

The true advancement for the game system was the yearly 'rating' of each team on their defensive and offensive line in each of these plays. Thus, when you played two teams, there was a die roll modifier for each play based on each defense.

The clock functions were also very good, allowing a true 'two minute drill' and the use of real game strategies.

Fran Tarkenton's Pro Football is a great time capsule with a look at the teams in the 1960s, before they merged to become the NFC and AFC.

Name: Goal!
Description: "Enjoy the thrills and skills of football by planning the moves that bring the goals." A very abstract two player simulation of a football match, published sometime in the late Sixties.

Name: 4th Street Baseball
Description:
4th Street Baseball is a baseball simulation game using individual ratings to recreate big league baseball action.  Ratings are printed in booklet format on perforated cardstock.  They measure 3.5" x 2.5" (the same size as a bubble-gum card).
   The game starts with the pitcher.  Each pitcher is rated for his ability to get the ball over the plate, the likelihood of him giving up the long ball, walk to strikeout ratio, hits allowed, etc.
   Each hitter has been rated for average, extra-base potential, strikeouts and walks, base running, stealing, bunting, and lefty-righty hitting. In addition, pitchers and hitters are rated for defensive range, error frequency, outfielder-catcher arms, and infielders ability to turn the double play.
   Five dice are employed in 4th Street Baseball...one twenty-sided (d20), two ten-sided (d10), and two six-sided (d6). 
   Play starts by determining the count.  The two d10 are rolled and the count is determined by looking at the pitcher's count column.  If the pitcher gets ahead in the count, his ratings, along with all of the defensive players behind him, increase.  If he falls behind, then the increase is instead given to the hitter.  The defense is allowed to position its players and selects a strategy card (fastball, breaking ball, pitchout, etc.).  The offense, likewise, selects a strategy card (hit and run, steal, etc.).  All five dice are rolled, the strategy cards are revealed, and the play continues by finding a "matchup" on the pitcher's card.  Matchups vary from balls hit to a specific fielder, to batter-pitcher battles, to ballpark and defensive positioning effects.  Once a matchup has been determined, the defender's rating is subtracted from the hitter's rating and the result is compared to the d20.  If the result is less than or equal to the d20, the hitter wins the matchup and the final result of the play is read off the hitter by adding the two d6 and referring to the appropriate column.  If the d20 result is higher, then the play result is found similarly on the defensive player.

The game comes with a book (or two books, depending upon the season) full of baseball player ratings which are perforated to 2.5" x 3.5" (the same size as a bubble-gum card), baseball fields (printed on 8.5" x 11" card stock, for each team), dice, strategy cards, an easy-to-read results chart, and score sheets.  All players are rated for the 2005 season, except those with less than 25 at bats or innings pitched, or pitchers who had 2 or less starts.

Name: Consequences
Description: The game of Consequences is a fun way to introduce or reinforce the idea that there is a consequence for all actions and behavior. Each card has an everyday task or behavior that results in a forward or backwards move. Roll the Dice to see how many stones you may travel. Follow the colorful stone path to the park, take a ride on the slide, go for ice cream and end at WATERLAND!!  Ages 3 and up

Name: Spelling Beez
Description:
Just as honeybees move from flower to flower collecting nectar to create honey, you'll move around the Spelling Beez game board collecting letters to create words. With two levels of play, children of all ages will enjoy this unique and educational spelling game. While younger children work to collect letters that spell simple words, older children are challenged by collecting letters for more difficult words. Older children will also share and learn interesting facts about honeybees as they try to collect the most pollen and nectar points to win the game. Spelling Beez is all you need to learn your ABC's.

Ages 4 -8

Contents:  Spelling Beez Game Board; 80 Pollen/Nectar Cards; 60 Spelling Beez Cards; Honeycomb Score Sheets; 4 Worker Bee Playing Pieces; Rules Booklet

Name: Zombie Manor
Description:
A mini-game that comes with the World Works Games cardstock model set "Shellendrak Manor". Players take the role of one of four treasure hunters searching for a lost pendant in the Manor.

Play takes place on the fully-constructed cardstock model.  The entire set must be printed on card stock paper and requires construction.

Name: Munchkin 5: De-Ranged
Description:
Publisher's DescriptionMore of the twisted humor of Steve Jackson and John Kovalic in a 112-card supplement for Munchkin!

De-Ranged has everything you love about Munchkin, including:


     A new Class! Rangers can tame monsters and ride them!
     Treasure! Track down the Philosopher's Scone, put Racing Stripes on your Steed, and fill your Canteen of Spleen with Carbonated Holy Water!
     Monsters! Beware the Telemarketer, the Poultrygeist, and the Undead Clowns.
     And more monsters: imports! That's right, unique monsters created by the European Munchkin publishers, available for the first time in English. Quake in fear at the Brothers Grimm and the Snerks! Or just kill them and take their stuff. Your choice.


Munchkin 5 -- De-Ranged. All the munchkin-ism of a prestige class, with none of that annoying roleplaying stuff.

				
				
					OtherPart of the Munchkin series.

Name: MathAnimals
Description: MathAnimals is an exciting game that teaches and reinforces addition, subtraction and multiplication skills for children of all ages. With the roll of a die, players race around the colorful game board trying to land their playing piece on the animal that represents the highest number. Then they either add, subtract or multiply the number on the die to the number they have landed on. The first to reach the "winning goal", a pre-set number that can change with each new game, is the winner!  With more than 6 variations of game play, MathAnimals will continue to stimulate learning and grow with your child for years to come. Ages 5 and up

Name: Situations
Description:
The “What if...” game that could save your child’s life- teaching kids how to avoid abduction and abuse.

The greatest way to reduce children’s fear of abduction and molestation, while at the same time offering them the highest degree of protection, is to give them knowledge of how to respond when faced with a potentially dangerous situation. With a “What if...” game format using question/answer cards, Situations™ teaches children how to recognize and respond when confronted with potentially life threatening scenarios. You and your children will learn many of the actual methods and schemes used by real child predators one may read about in local newspapers.

This game will also have a profound impact on opening the lines of communication between children and their parents with respect to these subjects that, for even the best of parents, are often difficult to discuss.

Situations™ is a must for homes, classrooms, daycares and other group settings. This game is specifically designed for play between one or more children AND a parent or teacher, and is NOT recommended to be played without an adult. 
Ages 4 and up

Name: Bug-A-Boo
Description: Rev the bug up and set it in the center of the board.  Watch as it spins out into one of the colored holes. That player gets to move his scoring peg.

Name: In and Out
Description:
In and Out is a simple roll and move game based on a swimming "Bath".  The edge of the pool is numbered 1 to 54.  Ten of the squares are entrances to the pool and when the player lands on them they must roll again and follow the path of a swimmer through the water back to the poolside.  The pool sections are similar to the familiar snakes and ladders, with one difference - the paths through the pool are marked out in squares and thus may represent delays as well as the usual short-cuts or backward steps.

The game appears to consist of only the board, counters and a die to be supplied by the player.  The instructions mention "dice" but it is likely that the game was intended to be played with one die.  Each player must roll "3" to begin and the exact number to finish which might be impossible with a pair of dice.

The board illustration is quite pleasant, possibly representing an Art Deco swimming pool.  All the swimmers are male, in red or blue trunks.

Valentine's Games were proud to proclaim the board as "British Manufacture".  The game is marked as copyright, but this is undated, although the provenance of the game suggests the game to be no later than 1950.  It is marked G12 suggesting that other boards were available from Valentine's Games.

Name: Outrageous Journalists
Description:
From the back of the box:

"To play the game, suspects (called players) make their getaway beginning and ending at Rockington Estate. Unlucky players will wear the disguise or go to Da Pokey. The lucky player landing on the Outrageous Journalist (sticking his microphone out of a manhole) will collect $10 grand.

"The player collecting the most evidence wins, and in this game evidence can be bought and sold."

This simple and colorful boardgame was meant to satirize the many court trails which fueled a media frenzy in the early nineties.

Name: Apples to Apples: Jewish Edition
Description:
From the back of the box:

Apples to Apples Jewish Edition brings the award winning card and party game, Apples to Apples, to Jewish Families and friends.  Players will delight in the clever comparisons while expanding their knowledge of Jewish themes.

Contains fun, new cards based on Jewish life, history and culture.

Part of the Apples to Apples Series.

Name: Dai Shogi
Description: Dai (or great) shogi is one of several large Shogi games that date from the Middle Ages of Japan.  It is thought to be a precursor of today's standard shogi game.  It is played on a 15×15 board.  Each player starts the game with sixty-five pieces of twenty-nine different types.  Unlike shogi, dai shogi does not permit "drops".

Name: Tensation
Description: Players place tiles numbered from 1-10 in vertical or horizontal sequences on the gameboard to try to score the most points. TENSATION is a game of skill because where a player chooses to place a tile will have the potential to substantially increase their score.

Name: Miljöspelet
Description:
To win the game all players most get one naturepicture (containing 6 cards) each. But this most be done before a picture of pollution are finished.

Components:
1 Rulebook (in Swedish)
1 Board
1 Dice
4 Markers
24 Cards

Name: Lilla spöket Laban spelet
Description: Roll the dice and move, go from start to finish in the castle. But on the way you can meet a ghost, witch, owl, king or maybe a bat. On the 48 different cards, "mysterious messages", you will get missions to complete.

Name: Monopoly: Gloucestershire
Description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Gloucestershire, in the United Kingdom.

Name: Monopoly: Devon
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Devon, in the United Kingdom.

Name: Monopoly: Hull
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Hull, in the United Kingdom.

Name: Monopoly: Jersey
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Jersey, a Crown dependency of Britain.

Name: Monopoly: Kent
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Kent, in the United Kingdom.

Name: Monopoly: Lancashire
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Lancashire, in the United Kingdom.

Name: Monopoly: Leicestershire Edition
Description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Leicestershire, in the United Kingdom.

Name: Monopoly: Manchester Edition
Description: The great property trading game finds its home in the heart of the North West. You can now play this classic game with the street names, landmarks and locations that give the city its distictive character. With its exciting, cosmopolitan atmosphere, galleries, theatres, Victorian architecture and sports clubs, Manchester is the liveliest of cities. Its comprehensive travel links will speed you around from Old Trafford to Granada Studios, the Museum of Science and Industry and, bustling Chinatown. As the hub of the North West, Manchester provides easy access to the moor and lake lands with Towns and Villages bursting with character. All of which makes for a fascinating edition of the world's favourite board game.

Name: Monopoly: Liverpool Football Club Champions Of Europe
Description: The classic boardgame takes on a new shape in this Liverpool edition. Featuring stars from the current squad alongside heroes from Liverpool's illustrious past and two of the club's greatest managers, this version of Monopoly requires players to accumulate wealth by aquiring stands and stadiums. Community Chest and Chance cards are replaced by Home and Away cards. It's an absolute must for all Liverpool fans!

Name: Monopoly: Liverpool Edition
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Liverpool, in the United Kingdom.

Name: Monopoly: Manchester United Football Club
Description: The classic boardgame takes on a new shape in this Manchester United edition. Featuring stars from the current squad alongside heroes from United's glorious past and two of football's greatest ever managers, this version of Monopoly requires players to accumulate wealth by aquiring stands and stadiums. Community Chest and Chance cards are replaced by Home and Away cards. It's an absolute must for all Reds fans!
Families: Sports Teams: Manchester United Football Club

Name: Monopoly: Middlesbrough
Description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Middlesbrough, in the United Kingdom.

Name: Monopoly: Newcastle & Gateshead
Description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Newcastle & Gateshead, in the United Kingdom.

Name: Monopoly: Chester & Cheshire
Description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Chester & Cheshire, in the United Kingdom.

Name: Monopoly: Thunderbirds
Description:
Thunderbirds to the rescue with 6 collectable die-cast vehicles! Complete with Evil Hood mover for optional play.
Join the Tracy family, Lady Penelope and all your other favourites. Race around the board on an International Rescue mission. Buy and sell vehicles, characters and locations. For extra fun you can add the special Evil Hood gameplay. Stay cool under pressure – may the richest player win!

Name: Monopoly: Aberdeen Edition
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Name: Inflatable Monopoly
Description: Inflatable Monopoly contains original cards, money and metal pieces in a handy carry case. Approx. size when inflated 700mm x 700mm x 300mm.

Name: Monopoly: University Of Leeds Edition
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with elements from the University Of Leeds, in the United Kingdom.

Name: Pocket-size Golf Card Game
Description:
POCKET-SIZE GOLF is an ideal size game to carry along wherever you go, to get in 18 holes of Golf while in the auto, in a boat, on an airplane, at home in the living room, or in bed.

Basically take turns turning over a card and moving your marker down the fairway.

Name: MiniMonFa Espansione Rigor Mortis
Description:
This expansion for MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy) brings in the game the fantastic world of Rigor Mortis, the dark overlord of Kragmortha, from the comic strip created by Riccardo Crosa. Finally you'll play with all the friends of genius of Evil, from Romolus the barbarian to Kira the werecat and Arkham-Oz the construct. You'll be able to use some of the more unusual magic items of Rigor Mortis like kyuss the talking sword. Everything is rounded up by a score of creatures and traps from the comic.

Rules for more than two players included.

Expands:

    MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy)


Other Expansions:

    MiniMonFa: Fairy Expansion
    MiniMonFa: Undead Expansion
    MiniMonFa Espansione Mondo Sotterraneo

Name: MiniMonFa Espansione Mondo Sotterraneo
Description:
The new thematic add-on for MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy) introduces 6 new heroes from the underworld and a score of new monsters to populate the dark places of the world... 
Dark denizens like Stone Golems, the nasty Meowticores, Giant Spiders, Hooked Monsters and flaming Salamanders are going to make things real hard our heroes, but will they survive the dreaded Spider Queen?
The expansion also adds a score of new items and traps to round up your underworld dungeon.

As usual, rules for more than two players are included.

Expands:

    MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy)


Other Expansions:

    MiniMonFa: Undead Expansion
    MiniMonFa: Fairy Expansion
    MiniMonFa Espansione Rigor Mortis

Name: Spelljammer: War Captain's Companion
Description:
This is a ship-to-ship combat game that was published as an expansion to the AD&D campaign setting Spelljammer.  The game is set in outer space, but the ships and rules are much like you'd expect in a traditional naval combat game like Wooden Ships & Iron Men.   The added dimension is that ships generally come with mages that can fire off many spells.  Rules are included for ramming, boarding, over 25 types of missile and small arms weapons, and lots of magic.

Components include rules for ship-to-ship combat, two large hex maps, and over 30 cardboard punch-out ships.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Whac-a-Mole Tower
Description: From the publisher: "Ring in the fun when you grab your mallet and give the mole a whack! Be quick and see if you can send this furry friend scurrying up-up-up the tower. WHAC-A-MOLE TOWER will keep kids entertained for hours! Four different games: HAMMER TIME: Race the clock to light the lights and ring the bell; LIGHTS OUT: Race to turn off the lights!; HIT 100: Be the first to get 100 points; 0-60: a head to head battle to be the first to win 60 points. Included with the game is a lightweight mallet, perfect for kid’s hands to grip."

Name: Die Schwarzwaldklinik
Description:
The hospital personnel of the Schwarzwaldklinik (Black Forest Hospital - a  TV-show from the 80's) is charged with trying to treat and make healthy the supplied patients (randomly drawn) as quickly as possible. After each visit, i.e. with each visit (after dice rolling and the moving of the meeple of a player located at the bed of the patient, a playing piece is set on one of the circles (2, 3 or 4) of the patient's card. Rolling a 6 results in reading and obeying some tasks on a randomly drawn event-card. The player, who provides the last playing piece for the individual patient's card, has cured the patient and gets his card.
The player with the most patient's cards wins.

Name: Ultimate Golf Trivia Game
Description:
Here's your chance to show how much knowledge you have in the sport you love. It doesn't matter if you're a beginner or a Tour player, this game is exciting and fun for all. Play the course and impress your friends as you collect Bonus Points and set a new course record! Expect grudging admiration from your opponents as you answer questions. Over 2,400 golf related questions and answers will help you and your friends increase your knowledge and appreciation for this greatest of games.

Plays like real golf, with the object of this game is to shoot the lowest score for the round. Play the course and collect Bonus Points and set a new course record!
Win Bonus Points along the way as you correctly answer questions . More questions are then asked upon reaching the green, and your total score for the hole is recorded on a scorecard. Sound easy? It is, if you can avoid water hazards, out-of-bounds and bunkers!

Includes Game Board, four player pieces, over 2,400 trivia questions, eight Mulligan cards, die, pencil and scorecards.

Name: Under Cross and Crescent
Description:
"Under Cross and Crescent" is a game about the struggle of empires in the middle ages.
Religion, politics, trade, assassination and crusades as well as jihads are a part of this game.
Your Empire will give birth to new heirs to the throne and send out priests to become pope, or 
if your nation is Islamic, you may launch a jihad against the catholic nations.
It´s all up to you to lead your nation to great power and wealth until the Mongol hordes invade.

This game features a new multi - purpose card system and the "Rondell - mechanism" from 
Mac Gerdts games "Antike" and "Imperial".

( If this game doesn't find a publisher until the end of 2007 it will be available for free print & play )

Name: The Aleutians Campaign: The North America Theatre in WW2
Description:
(from the publisher:)

During a war that blazed across most of the world, there was only one place in North America that was invaded and occupied by the Axis. The hard fighting that took place in the freezing fog and the logistical nightmare of getting there in the first place doesn't get the place in the history of the Second World War that it deserves.

This game is a strategic simulation of the fighting in the Aleutians between Japan and the United States from June 1942 to August 1943.

Most game turns represent one month of real time. Winter turns represent two months. 
 Contents: two 11 x 17-inch game maps, 247 counters that have to be mounted and cut-out, charts and tables, English rules

Name: Dark & Dangerous Skies
Description: Earth is in trouble, and it is up to the players to explore space and find a suitable planet for colonization, as well as bringing back food and energy sources for use back on Earth.  Part of the Family Pastimes cooperative game series.

Name: Jungle Craze
Description:
From the box: "An Adventure Game For All Those Who Dare To Enter The Taetsequama Jungle"

Jungle Craze is a roll the dice and move along the path board game.  Instead of a simple path, however, the path crosses and intersects, often giving the adventurer choices, but sometimes forcing the adventurer into an undesirable path.  Adventurers collect survival gear, hire guides, deal with natives, and of course, challenge Taetsequama.  To win, they must steal the treasure from the native temple and then return to the start area.  However, once the treasure has been stolen from the temple, other players can steal the treasure by landing on the adventurer carrying it.

The instructions list three levels of play which add complexity for higher levels.  Some of the challenges involve rolling specific numbers on the dice -- "Snake Eyes must be rolled within 10 tries."  Some  issues are decided based on the player's life experiences -- "If you've seen 'Dumbo', go to the south elephant walk.  If not, go to the north elephant walk."

Name: Hook, Line & Sinker
Description:
From the back of the box:

Hook Line & Sinker is an easy to play, fun game that will entertain the entire family and you don't have to be a fisherman to enjoy playing Hook Line and Sinker. It is a game of chance that depicts most aspects of a day's fishing in a boat. In the box are 82 colorful playing cards representing ten varieties of fish. Each fish is worth a set amount of points from the low scoring Garfish to the mighty Marlin which can score you 100 points. Every cast of the dice will put you in an hilarious and exciting fishing predicament. The winner is the person who catches the most amount of fish with the highest points score, which means you can finish last around the board and still win the game. Try fishing in the lounge room, it's sure to get you in, Hook Line and Sinker.

Name: The Dolphin Training Game
Description:
The Dolphin Training Game... The title says it all.
Teach your dolphins many tricks like a Tail-walk or a goodbye wave and become the best dolphin-trainer of the bunch.

The game is based on and uses actual dolphin names from the Dolphin Academy in Curacao. The game is actually a trivia game for the most part with over 200 cards with questions and assignments.

The action takes place on a board representing the island of Curacao, home base of the Academy, and features several basins where you can teach your dolphins new tricks and collect fish.

There's a little extra for (beginner) puzzle fans: The board is divided in 13 pieces, with a large dolphin-picture on the back, making the game also usable as an old fashioned puzzle.
